Job Title: Business and Procurement Operations Manager, Amazon Live

Location: New York, NY

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Management, Manufacturing

Description:
Description

Amazon Shoppable Videos (ASV) is a growing business within the Amazon Advertising, IMDb and Grand Challenge (AIGC) business unit. AIGC is one of the fastest growing business units within Amazon, with the highest percentage margin contribution of any large business.

Key job responsibilities

 Lead contractor team (3+) charged with purchasing, inventory tracking, and transactional best practices for ASV. Supervise reporting, forecasting, budgeting processes and tools for key programs; track resource allocation, including personnel, equipment and budget, ensuring optimal resource utilization by forecasting demands, anticipating project needs, and proposing adjustments. Develop audit mechanisms to drive scalability and compliance with Amazon protocols, including spend and transaction policy, shipping policy and donation policies. Develop and manage KPIs to measure, control and benchmark procurement processes including creation of recurring metrics reports to drive improvements for ASV. Build productivity plans. Write business narratives (e.g., proposed strategies, standard operating procedures and policy documents), and present them to leadership and cross functional teams. Align with internal customers, Finance and Studio Operations to understand budgetary targets and develop methods of measuring and defining savings, value and other category metrics Partner with suppliers and various internal teams to develop mechanisms for opening and reconciling purchase orders and invoices and ensure timely resolution of vendor payment issues. Communicate across a range of locales, roles, and functions (e.g., design, product/program, engineering, marketing, finance, PR, sales, external partners). Have an entrepreneurial spirit, show excellent judgment, be passionate about high standards (is never satisfied with the status quo), deliver innovative solutions.

A day in the life

As Business and Procurement Operations Manager for the ASV content team, you will lead ASV’s vendor management and merchandise procurement, including budgeting, forecasting, inventory management, contract management and purchase order management. You will drive contract negotiations and drive supplier management KPI and metrics reporting, while working with stakeholders to find and understand deviation and improvement areas. You will provide procurement leadership and align with our content leadership team to drive efficiencies and improvements at our studio site(s). You will be comfortable leading complex operational data analysis projects, developing and implementing process improvements, and communicating findings and recommendations to senior management through data visualizations and reports. You will have experience and thrive in environments that require you to develop structure where none exists. In short, you will be the lead procurement manager for a fun, innovative, and growing business unit within Amazon.

About The Team

Amazon Shoppable Videos (ASV) is a growing business within the Amazon Advertising, IMDb and Grand Challenge (AIGC) business unit. AIGC is one of the fastest growing business units within Amazon, with the highest percentage margin contribution of any large business. ASV is delivering the video shopping experience to Amazon consumers, with a purpose to enable customers to find inspiration, information, entertainment, and community through videos at any point in their shopping journey. The ASV team designs, builds and operates both owned and operated destination experiences (e.g.amazon.com/live, Amazon Live’s channel on Prime Video), as well as federated experiences across theAmazon.com website (e.g. Amazon homepage, product detail pages for over 21MM products). In addition, ASV sources shoppable video content from brands, influencers and consumers to populate both types of experiences.

We are open to hiring candidates to work out of one of the following locations:

New York, NY, USA

Basic Qualifications

 Comfortable with a high degree of ambiguity 7+ years of experience in supply chain operations including supplier/ vendor relationship management 7+ years of direct people management experience Experience with variance analysis with a track record of using data to drive decision-making. Excellent communication and interpersonal abilities to collaborate effectively across diverse teams Bachelor's degree or relevant experience in Business, Operations Management or Production, Operations Management Proficiency in Microsoft Excel software or equivalent

Preferred Qualifications

 Experience in Coupa or other financial management/procurement software Experience with cost accounting Previous experience in a financial business operations capacity at a Social Media, Streaming and / or Media company Understanding of key performance indicators and financial metrics critical to media and social media enterprises Familiarity with video production processes, digital media, and streaming technologies 5+ years professional experience managing large-scale budgets within the media, entertainment or streaming industry

Amazon is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Amazon is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, protected veteran status, disability, age, or other legally protected status. For individuals with disabilities who would like to request an accommodation, please visit https://www.amazon.jobs/en/disability/us.

Our compensation reflects the cost of labor across several US geographic markets. The base pay for this position ranges from $92,300/year in our lowest geographic market up to $181,400/year in our highest geographic market. Pay is based on a number of factors including market location and may vary depending on job-related knowledge, skills, and experience. Amazon is a total compensation company. Dependent on the position offered, equity, sign-on payments, and other forms of compensation may be provided as part of a total compensation package, in addition to a full range of medical, financial, and/or other benefits. For more information, please visit https://www.aboutamazon.com/workplace/employee-benefits. This position will remain posted until filled. Applicants should apply via our internal or external career site.


Company - Amazon Advertising LLC

Job ID: A2618406

Experience Level (if available): Mid-Senior level
